content: radiance 6 inch square radiance is a free 6 inch crochet square pattern and devotional about shining our light i love the radiance that you can visibly see on a person s face that loves the lord with their whole being i want that radiance- and so i wanted to study radiance and where it comes from ecc 11 7 truly the light is sweet and a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to behold the sun a huge thank you to my fabulous testers linda nelson kelly youngblood joanne jones bekah doughty and carmen carpenter yarn caron simply soft hook i abbreviations beg- beginning chain-chain double_crochet-double_crochet hk-hook half_double_crochet-half_double_crochet lp or lps-loop or loops round- round single_crochet-single_crochet slip_stitch- slip_stitch space or sps- space or spaces st or sts- stitch or stitches treble_crochet- triple/treble_crochet yo- yarn over special stitches dtr- is a double triple/treble working as a treble_crochet wrap your hook with yarn 3 times rather than just 2 and pull through 2 loops 4 times rather than just 3 by cynthia boylan page 1 radiance 6 inch square begin ♥ round 1-starting with color a chain 4 slip_stitch to first st to create ring chain 3 half_double_crochet chain 1 7 times and join with sl st to 2nd chain from beginning ch3 8 half_double_crochet 8 ch1 space round 2- slip_stitch into first ch1 space ch3 2 double_crochet in same space skip next half_double_crochet 3 double_crochet in each ch1 space 7 times and join with slip_stitch to top of beginning ch3 24 double_crochet round 3- ch3 sk1 slip_stitch to next st 12 times 12 ch3 space round 4- slip_stitch into ch3 space single_crochet dtr single_crochet in each ch3 space when doing the dtr- push the stitch which will project outward into a loop to the front before making the single_crochet after it join with a slip_stitch to first single_crochet 24 single_crochet 12 dtr finish off with color a if using more than one color round 5- change to color b if desired and make 2 single_crochet in between the 2 single_crochet stitches from the previous row and 2 single_crochet in the st that you see behind the dtr this is actually the top of the dtr- but is behind because the single_crochet pushes the stitch down into a nupp shown in photo below continue around and join to beg single_crochet with slip_stitch 48 single_crochet round 6- chain 3 and double_crochet in same st * double_crochet in next st half_double_crochet in next 2 sts single_crochet in next 4 sts half_double_crochet in next 2 sts double_crochet in next st 2 double_crochet in next sts chain 3 ** 2 double_crochet in next st * repeat from * 3 more times ending at the ** on the final round join with a slip_stitch to top of beg ch3 24 double_crochet 4 ch3 16 half_double_crochet 16 single_crochet
